item.title: Checking dependencies for security vulnerabilities
item.description: A security vulnerability is a nightmare scenario. In my Spring: Security Hardening guide I explain that static code analysis can check your code for common security mistakes. But that raises another question - what about other people’s code? When you consider that your code is actually a fraction of the deployed artifact it gets really scary. Luckily for us, there is a variety of automation we can deploy to cover this scenario.

item.title: Spring Boot: Security Hardening
item.description: When working on the Squaddy App I’ve seen a LOT of internet background noise in our logs. It’s especially timely given the recent Log4j2 Remote Code Execution exploit. We’ve done a lot of work to ensure we stay as safe as possible and I wanted to go through some recommendations. What we mean by ‘Safe’? Whenever talking about security we’re really asking “How confident am I this will work as I expect?
